intro: Melampyrum pratense subsp. latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf touch-me-not, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, characterized by its parasitic or hemiparasitic nature, though this subspecies is not fully parasitic. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands, and it features slender stems with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are usually orange-red or yellow, arranged in clusters, and are known for their distinctive spurred petals.
